name: Frozen Irish Coffee
description: This drink is inspired by the frozen Irish coffee served at Molly’s at the Market in the French Quarter of New Orleans, where it’s served from a frozen daiquiri machine. Freezing milk in an ice cube tray gives you a similar creamy consistency to the version at Molly’s, which contains no ice. Brandy provides a mellower flavor than Irish whiskey, but feel free to substitute whiskey for the brandy if you prefer.
keywords: brandy, coffee, coffee liqueur, milk, vanilla ice cream, dessert
recipeIngredient: 1 1/4 cups whole milk, frozen in an ice cube tray
4 ounces strong coffee or cold brew, chilled
1/4 teaspoon fresh coffee grounds, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Add ice cream, frozen milk cubes, chilled coffee, brandy and coffee liqueur to a blender. Combine on high until the ice is crushed and the drink is smooth. (It will have the consistency of a thin milkshake.)
Divide between highball glasses and swirl 1/8 teaspoon coffee grounds on the top of each drink.
